Add Cites to RMarkdown
========================================================

```{r setup, include = FALSE, cache = FALSE}
library(RefManageR)
#library(bibtex)
setwd("C:/Users/Matthew/Documents/biblatex/RefManager/code/RefManageR/R")
# source("rmdCite.R")
#lapply(list.files(pattern = ".R$", full = TRUE), source)
bib <- ReadBib(system.file("Bib", "biblatexExamples.bib", 
                           package = "RefManageR"), check = FALSE)
bib2 <- ReadBib(system.file("Bib", "RJC.bib", package = "RefManageR"))
BibOptions(bib.style = "alphabetic", check.entries = FALSE)
bib <- sort(bib, return.labs = TRUE, sorting = "none")
bib2 <- sort(bib2, return.labs = TRUE, sorting = "none")
```
  This is an R Markdown document. This is an example of a citation in the text `r Citet(bib, "loh")`. Now we cite in parentheses `r AutoCite(bib, "baez/online")`.

These are reports `r Citet(bib, bibtype = "Report", cite.style = "authortitle")`.
You can also embed plots, for example: 
  
```{r fig.width=7, fig.height=6}
plot(cars)
```
Add a reference to CTAN without citing `r NoCite(bib = bib, title = "CTAN")`.  Add a reference from another bibliography `r AutoCite(bib2, title = "retrospective sampling problems", cite.style = "alphabetic")`.  Look at all my Aristotle: `r TextCite(bib, author = "Aristotle", cite.style = "numeric")`.

**References**

```{r results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
PrintBibliography(bib, .opts = list(check.entries = FALSE))
```

**More References**

```{r results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
PrintBibliography(bib2)
```
